Key Match Events: Evan Mobley tallied 25 points and Donovan Mitchell added 24 points and seven assists as the Cavaliers improved to 5-0 with a 134-110 victory.
LeBron James was cheered throughout pre-game warm-ups and during his traditional pregame powder toss along the scorer’s table.
LeBron James thrilled the crowd with a breakaway dunk in the first minute.
A tribute video for LeBron James and rookie guard Bronny was played during the first half.
LeBron James finished with 26 points, six rebounds, and six turnovers.
Bronny James assisted on Dalton Knecht’s dunk before scoring his first NBA points on a step-back, 14-foot jumper over Tristan Thompson with 2:03 left.
Cleveland shot 17-of-22 from the floor in the first quarter and made 8 of 13 treys.
Donovan Mitchell had 13 points in the first 5:05 as the hosts led 42-23 after one.
Jarrett Allen finished with 20 points and 17 rebounds.
Mobley had eight points in the first two minutes of the fourth quarter, including a wide-open slam to boost the Cavaliers’ lead to 105-79. Mobley would score 17 in the fourth.
Lakers star Anthony Davis, who entered the game leading the NBA in scoring at 32.8 points a game, finished with 22 points and 13 rebounds.
